entry.et: Middle English curs, from Old English

def.dt: :a prayer or invocation for harm or injury to come upon one :imprecation
:evil or misfortune that comes as if in response to imprecation or as retribution
:a cause of great harm or misfortune :torment
:to use profanely insolent language against :blaspheme curse God and die Job 2:9(REB)
:to call upon divine or supernatural power to send injury upon was cursed and fears he will die
:to execrate in fervent and often profane terms cursed by future generations unless we act now
:to bring great evil upon :afflict a land cursed with famine
